intro: Tetroncium, commonly known as the marsh helleborine, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their unique, often showy flowers that resemble those of the orchid family. Tetroncium species typically grow in wet, marshy environments, thriving in humid and shaded conditions. They have a rhizomatous root system and produce small, greenish or yellowish flowers with a distinctive, often fragrant scent. The genus includes several species, such as Tetroncium polyphyllum, which is native to parts of Europe and Asia.
